subject: Business
title: The Attention Economy
description: A quick, practical guide to The Attention Economy.

hook.text: The average person sees 4,000 to 10,000 ads per day. They remember maybe three.

buildup.text: Herbert Simon warned in 1971: a wealth of information creates a poverty of attention.

discovery.text: Attention is the scarcest resource in marketing. Every brand competes for the same limited cognitive bandwidth.

twist.text: More ad spend doesn't equal more attention. People have learned to tune out anything that looks like an ad.

climax.text: The winners earn attention through value: education, entertainment, or utility â€” not just interruption.

punchline.text: You can't buy attention anymore. You have to earn it.

quiz.question: What did Herbert Simon warn about in 1971?
options: A wealth of information creates a poverty of attention
